solution.text:
As per the theorem: all terminating rational number can be expressed in the form of \(\frac pq\), where \(q=5^m\times 2^n\)
Now we can write \(_{{Decimal(l)/pow(10,j)}}_=\frac {_{l}_}{10^_{j}_}\)
We can write \(10^_{j}_=(5\times 2)^_{j}_=5^_{j}_\times 2^_{j}_\)
so, \(_{{Decimal(l)/pow(10,j)}}_=\frac {_{l}_}{10^_{j}_}=\frac {_{l}_}{5^_{j}_\times 2^_{j}_}\)

content.text:
A rational number _{{Decimal(l)/pow(10,j)}}_ is represented in the form \(\frac {_{l}_}{5^a\times 2^b}\)
Find the value of \(b\)
